outputs.output_descr: The Regional programme will focus on creating an enabling environment for reducing the vulnerabilities of people to HIV and promoting safe mobility.  Regional and inter-country capacity of key stakeholders will be developed to respond to the human development, governance, human rights, and gender challenges of HIV/AIDS, mobility and trafficking in the region.  In the context of regional efforts to promote the achievement of MDGs, the regional programme will build capacity for costing and developing comprehensive, multi-sectoral responses.  The regional project will work in close partnership with the UNAIDS family, inter-regional bodies, their member governments.
Strengthening Socioeconomic empowerment of women living with HIV in Cambodia and India

donor_name: JOINT UNITED NATIONS PROGRAMME ON HIV/AIDS
outputs.output_descr: Joint United Nations Initiatives on Mobility and HIV/AIDS in South East Asia - Funding received from UNAIDS - The outputs are the same as the Project ID 00058655

The role of civil society in regional advocacy initiatives and in the production of strategic information relating to Human Rights, men who have sex with men (MSM), and transgender persons in HIV responses is strengthened.

Working at regional, national and local levels, the project objectives are (1) to strengthen the capacity of CBOs and healthcare providers to improve the delivery of HIV related services for MSM and TG (2) to improve the enabling environment and strategic
advocacy regarding MSM, TG, and HIV related issues (3) to improve the development and utilization of strategic information on MSM, TG and HIV to strengthen national responses, and  (4) to promote the strategic use of ICT to effectively scale up the HIV response among MSM and TG in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines and Timor Leste.

donor_name: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
outputs.output_descr:
Objectives:
1. Build a knowledge baseline of the legal, social, political and institutional environments in which LGBT rights advocates and organizations operate while developing an understanding for the capacity of LGBT rights advocates to engage in policy dialogue and community mobilization.
2. Promote understanding of the human rights of LGBT human persons, the challenges they face in terms of stigma and discrimination and LGBT-inclusive development within USAID, UNDP and Development Partners through research reports and multimedia products which convey results of the review and analysis work.

project_descr: HIV, Human Development and Mobility in Asia and the Pacific  Phase II
project_title: HIV, Human Development & Mobility in Asia & the Pacific
